intro: Syngonanthus pulchellus, commonly known as the purple-veined sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant features small, clustered flowers with distinctive purple veins on the petals. Its leaves are usually succulent and arranged in a rosette pattern. Syngonanthus pulchellus is often found in open, sunny habitats such as coastal dunes and dry woodlands.
